metadata.title: CVE-2018-7191 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the tun subsystem in the Linux kernel before 4.13.14, dev_get_valid_nameis not called before register_netdevice. This allows local users to cause adenial of service (NULL pointer dereference and panic) via anioctl(TUNSETIFF) call with a dev name containing a / character. This issimilar to CVE-2013-4343.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required
